skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.

effects.description: Leadership: +9

skillTree.localised_description: The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: To fire the forges and bring true craft and artifice back into the world.

effects.description:
Oathgold from buildings: +10%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: A true Lord knows the Underway, his Dwarfhold and how to fight under the ground better than anyone.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15%

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.

effects.description: Armour: +6

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15
Charge bonus: +30

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +5%
Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Greenskins
Weapon strength: +8%
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.

effects.description: Speed: +7%
Speed: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

effects.description: Ability: "Deadly Onslaught"

skillTree.localised_description: Clan Drazhkarak is the royal clan of the Black Mountains and led by Alrik Ranulfsson, occupying strategic positions in the Black Mountains.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing damage: +8% for Longbeards units
	(all armies factionwide)

Melee attack: +2  for Longbeards units
	(all armies factionwide)

Armour: +5 for Longbeards units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Grungni is the Dwarf God of Mining, Metalworking, and Stoneworking and one of the three most revered of the Ancestor Gods. Dwarfs of the Hornholds believe that the spirit of Grungni will bring continued prosperity to the Black Mountains.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +50%

Leadership: +5
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 5% for Dwarf melee infantry units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Grimnir is the Dwarf God of War and Courage and the patron of the Slayer Cults. Grimnir's temples exist in every corner of the Black Mountains, and the worship of Grimnir makes his warriors fearless.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% for melee Infantry units

Charge bonus: +20%
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Dwarf melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Dwarfs in the Black Mountains are skilled weaponsmiths, allowing them to continue long campaigns against Urk and Grobi in the South.

skillTree.localised_description: Although many Dwarfs of Karak Hirn use heavy weapons, their shields are still essential equipment, and the Black Mountains provide plenty of resources for shield manufacturing.

skillTree.localised_description: "When I were but a lad, my father, the King, taught me three things: Never accept a gift from a Elf. Never trust gold that glistens in darkness. Never forget a grudge. On his deathbed I swore to uphold those values to me own dying day, and Grungni willing I will."

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Karak Hirn, known as the Hornhold to humans, is the most important Dwarf Kingdom in the Black Mountains between Tilea and the southern borders of The Empire.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Thanes
Upkeep: -50% for Longbeards units
Upkeep: +50% for Thunderers, Gyrocopter, Gyrobomber and Dwarf blackpowder and fire-based units

items.colour_text: When the Karak Hirn Dwarfs fight their enemies, Alrik's Axe of Retribution shines silver at the front of any battle.

effects.description: Ability: "Axe of Retribution"
Bonus vs Large: +10
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +25
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10%
Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Greenskins

items.colour_text: The cunningly wrought runes on this ancient battle-helm give the wearer the eyesight and awareness of a hunting eagle.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Helm of Eagles"

	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

items.colour_text: Suits of heavy golden armour are the traditional battle garb of the King of Karak Hirn and his Shield Bearers.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Alrik Ranulfsson is the  King of Karak Hirn, also known as the Hornhold. Even amongst a race as steeped in tradition as the Dwarfs, King Alrik is regarded as particularly devoted to the customs of his ancestors, and the Dwarfs of Clan Drazhkarak eschew modern military innovations.
